S1_Notes: Schools are closed starting Monday, March 16 till April 20, 2020. This measure applies to schools, daycare centers, and all organizations that are in charge of the education and care of our children. After this date the situation will be evaluated. See letter of the Minister of Education. Retrieved from: /web/20200406202340/https://www.overheid.aw/news/news_47033/item/crisis-measures-by-the-government-of-aruba-in-connection-with-coronavirus-covid-19_48509.html
S2_Notes: 'ORANJESTAD - The Police Department of Aruba has announced that they will be enforcing the curfew that starts on Saturday 21 of March 2020 at 9:00 pm. Some exceptions require being outside during the curfew, like security personnel, hotel employers, waste management, etc. but they have to send an official company letter by email to cmo@crisis.aw requesting an exemption. The company letter should include the logo, name of the particular employee and his or her ID and should be signed by the company director or acting director or by the Human Resources Manager'. Retrieved from:  /web/20200406203242/https://www.overheid.aw/news/news_47033/item/police-of-aruba-aruba-under-curfew_48686.html
S3_Notes:
-Starting March 29, 2020, a Shelter in Place is into effect for the entire population, as announced in the AB2020No.43. This means that you are not allowed to leave the house, only for necessary things, such as buying food, going to the pharmacy, exercising or getting gas. The measures apply to non-essential groups. See overview of non-essential businesses/ activities. Businesses must instruct their customers that they must keep 2 meters apart. If the social distance rule is not enforced, companies will be closed and fined. A ban on gathering (loitering) has also been issued, in particular the prohibition of group formation in public space by 4 or more people, with the exception of families living under the same roof.   
Retrieved at: https://web.archive.org/web/20200402180605/https://www.overheid.aw/news/news_47033/item/crisis-measures-by-the-government-of-aruba-in-connection-with-coronavirus-covid-19_48509.html
S6_Notes:
-Starting March 29, 2020, a Shelter in Place is into effect for the entire population, as announced in the AB2020No.43. This means that you are not allowed to leave the house, only for necessary things, such as buying food, going to the pharmacy, exercising or getting gas. The measures apply to non-essential groups. See overview of non-essential businesses/ activities. Businesses must instruct their customers that they must keep 2 meters apart. If the social distance rule is not enforced, companies will be closed and fined. A ban on gathering (loitering) has also been issued, in particular the prohibition of group formation in public space by 4 or more people, with the exception of families living under the same roof.   
Retrieved at: https://web.archive.org/web/20200402180605/https://www.overheid.aw/news/news_47033/item/crisis-measures-by-the-government-of-aruba-in-connection-with-coronavirus-covid-19_48509.html
S7_Notes:
Effective March 29, 2020, Aruba will restrict entry to Aruba to all travelers, including legal residents of Aruba.
Retrieved from: https://web.archive.org/web/20200402175148/https://cw.usconsulate.gov/news-events/covid-19-information/
S8_Notes: -Fiscal reform will be eliminated from the 2020 national budget 'ORANJESTAD- During a conference call between Prime Minister Evelyn Wever-Croes, Prime Minister of Curacao Eugene Rhuggenaath and Prime Minister Silveria Jacobs of Sint-Maarten, the leaders discussed the developments in the Netherlands and about economics and how they would finance the effects caused by the Corona Virus'. https://www.overheid.aw/news/news_47033/item/fiscal-reform-will-be-eliminated-from-the-2020-national-budget_48710.html
S9_Notes:
-'The Government of Aruba provides the opportunity for businesses and employees to apply for compensation from the Emergency Social Assistance Funds FASE to help cover the loss of income of employees due to the reduction of working hours, causing them to earn less than AWG. 950, 00 monthly'. (The deadline for submission of the application for social assistance for June 2020 is June 1, 2020).
https://www.overheid.aw/news/news_47033/item/flexibility-package-for-covid-19-crisis_48794.html

S1_Notes: On March 14, 2020, the Afghan government announced closure of schools for a month. Academic year in most of the country beings on March 21st. As of now, the schools will not start the new academic year until April 21, 2020: /web/20200401000832/http://www.afghanistantimes.af/afghanistan-shuts-schools-bans-public-events-amid-coronavirus-fears/

S1_Notes: Schools in the UAE to remain closed for the rest of the academic year per the Ministry of Education Twitter account: https://whichschooladvisor.com/uae/school-news/covid19-distance-learning-continued-to-end-of-term-3

Tweet posted on 15/03/2020: 
'Informations sur le #coronavirus?
??http://info-coronavirus.be
??0800/14.689 (08h00 - 20h00)
??via @CrisiscenterBE & @SanteBelgique
Nous répondons tous les jours à vos questions entre 09h00 et 18h00.'
(https://twitter.com/SanteBelgique)

This tweet outlines where citizens can access information about coronavirus: on a dedicated website, by phone and by twitter, everyday. 

The website and twitter account has since been updated daily.

https://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/geral/noticia/2020-03/governo-restringe-entrada-de-estrangeiros-no-pais-por-30-dias 23th March the federal government lauched a law restricting the entrance of foreigners from some nationalities in the country. The measure is valid for 30 days.

S1_Notes: 'The extension according to Mottley also means: 'School cannot reopen on Tuesday next week.' Therefore, a conversation needs to be had on e-learning and distance learning for schools. In terms of CSEC and CAPE examinations, talks are to be had with the Caribbean Examination Council (CXC).' Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200414233137/https://www.loopnewsbarbados.com/content/covid-19-curfew-extended-barbados-relaxed-restrictions
S2_Notes: 'Barbados' curfew has been extended to 11.59 pm, May 3, 2020.' Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200414233137/https://www.loopnewsbarbados.com/content/covid-19-curfew-extended-barbados-relaxed-restrictions
S3_Notes: 'Barbados' curfew has been extended to 11.59 pm, May 3, 2020.' Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200414233137/https://www.loopnewsbarbados.com/content/covid-19-curfew-extended-barbados-relaxed-restrictions
S5_Notes: Barbados has established a COVID-19 information hotline that can be reached at 246-536-4500. Source: https://bb.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/ Additionaly, information is being posted on the Government Information Service website with a special web page dedicated to Covid-19. Source: https://gisbarbados.gov.bb/blog/extracts-emergency-management-covid-19-order-2020
S6_Notes: 'Barbados' curfew has been extended to 11.59 pm, May 3, 2020.' Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200414233137/https://www.loopnewsbarbados.com/content/covid-19-curfew-extended-barbados-relaxed-restrictions
S7_Notes: A mandatory 14-day quarantine in a Government facility for all persons entering Barbados. Source: https://bb.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
S8_Notes: 'The Government of Barbados (GoB) has identified upfront emergency health and capital expenditures needed to manage and mitigate the spread of infection. This includes resources to refurbish the hospital and clinics, build isolation centers, and provision critical medications and supplies.' Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200414010927/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
S9_Notes: From 7 to 2% for Commercial Banks. 'The Central Bank of Barbados (CBB) announced a series of measures (effective April 1, 2020) to help support commercial banks and other deposit-taking institution manage the economic fallout from the coronavirus shock. Specifically: i) the Bank’s discount rate at which it provides overnight lending to banks and deposit-taking non-banks licensed under the Financial Institutions Act was reduced from 7 percent to 2 percent; ii) the securities ratio for banks was lowered from 17.5 percent to 5 percent; iii) the 1.5 percent securities ratio for non-bank deposit taking licensees was eliminated; and, iv) the Bank indicated it stands ready to make collateralized loans for up to six months as liquidity support for licensees.' Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200414010927/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
S10_Notes: 'On Friday, a 40-foot container from China arrived at the Bridgetown Port with 4500 goggles and over 16,000 face masks. The QEH Chair disclosed that another shipment from the Asian country could arrive by the middle of this week. 'We have another container due in on Wednesday with more surgical masks and gowns. So what we have been doing, not only in the case of ventilators, is ensuring that we have a steady supply.'' Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200410020309/https://barbadostoday.bb/2020/04/07/barbados-looking-to-other-suppliers-for-equipment/
S12_Notes: 'Mass testing of persons for the COVID-19 virus is a luxury that this country cannot afford at this time. COVID-19 Czar, Richard Carter, says this is because of the limitations on the availability of the items required for testing, including swabs and test kits. He was speaking yesterday on one of the local radio call-in programmes as he responded to a caller who suggested that everyone should be tested. Carter, reflecting on the finite supplies, indicated that they are limiting the testing to ensure that the resources currently at their disposal are used in instances where they are absolutely necessary. 'Mass testing of the whole population is not an option that we can use at this moment and it is perhaps not an indication of where we are in the course of the epidemic,' he stated.' Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200407025412/https://www.barbadosadvocate.com/news/no-mass-testing-right-now
S13_Notes: 'Acting Chief Medical Officer Dr Anton Best said there is no evidence yet of community spread of novel coronavirus (COVID-19) but health officials are aggressively using contact tracing to limit an increase in infections.' Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200406134607/https://www.nationnews.com/nationnews/news/244799/-aggressive-contact-tracing-continues

S3_Notes: 'The government banned all private and public events starting at midnight on March 17. It also ordered the closure of bars, restaurants, sports facilities and cultural spaces. Only businesses providing essential goods to the population – such as grocery stores, bakeries, pharmacies, banks and post offices – are to remain open.' [http://web.archive.org/web/20200402101529/https://www.swissinfo.ch/eng/covid-19_switzerland-declares-coronavirus-crisis-an--extraordinary--situation/45620148]
S7_Notes: 'The travel restrictions mapped out by the Commission have been unfurled by 26 members of the Union, as well as four other countries who are part of Schengen but not of the EU: Switzerland, Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein. Ireland was the only EU country not to implement the border closure.' Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200412202912/https://www.forbes.com/sites/tamarathiessen/2020/04/11/europe-borders-may-close-to-september-due-to-us-covid-19-threat/
Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200403060015/https://www.gob.cl/coronavirus/plandeaccion/

S4_Notes: Urged to avoid overloading buses and taxis: https://www.journalducameroun.com/en/cameroon-closes-schools-borders-among-measures-to-contain-coronavirus/
S7_Notes: 'The Cameroon government has taken steps to contain the spread of COVID-19, including shutting schools and universities, closing borders, banning mass gatherings, encouraging people to follow hygiene rules, and creating a help line.' Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200412215903/https://www.hrw.org/news/2020/04/10/cameroon-allow-aid-access-amid-pandemic

'The Congolese government has already taken steps to stop the spread of the virus, including restricting all forms of internal and international travel except for cargo; banning large gatherings; closing bars, restaurants, places of worship and schools; and shutting down borders.' Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200408194031/https://www.hrw.org/news/2020/04/03/dr-congo-respecting-rights-key-amid-covid-19

S1_Notes:
The general lock-down and quarantine was prolonged until April 27 by  the Decree 531 issued by the President on April 08, 2020.
https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%20531%20DEL%208%20DE%20ABRIL%20DE%202020.pdf
S2_Notes:
The workplace closing remains mostly unchanged, except for one additional exception related to public works. The general lock-down and quarantine was prolonged until April 27 by the Decree 531 issued by the President on April 08, 2020.
https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%20531%20DEL%208%20DE%20ABRIL%20DE%202020.pdf
S3_Notes:
The cancelation of public events remains unchanged. The general lock-down and quarantine was prolonged until April 27 by the Decree 531 issued by the President on April 08, 2020.
https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%20531%20DEL%208%20DE%20ABRIL%20DE%202020.pdf
S4_Notes:
The limited operation of public transport remains unchanged. The general lock-down and quarantine was prolonged until April 27 by the Decree 531 issued by the President on April 08, 2020. The Decree 531 establishes that public transport must be guaranteed for those activities that are necessary to deal with COVID-19 and the economic activities that are allowed by the decree (e.g. food, banking etc.).
https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%20531%20DEL%208%20DE%20ABRIL%20DE%202020.pdf
S5_Notes:
The government has continued its educative and informative campaigns about COVID-19. Additionally, the Decree 516, issued on April 4 by the Ministry of Information and Communication Technologies, established that during the “State of National Emergency”  (that finalizes, unless it is extended, on April 15) open television channels must offer spaces for government messages about COVID-19 at certain periodic schedules. Here’s the link for Decree 516:
https://www.mintic.gov.co/portal/604/articles-126488_dec_516.pdf
S6_Notes:
The limitation of internal movement remains mostly unchanged. The general lock-down and quarantine was prolonged until April 27 by the Decree 531 issued by the President on April 08, 2020. The Decree 531 establishes that domestic flights are only permitted in three specific cases and that internal public transport will only operate for activities linked with COVID and to guarantee the economic activities that are authorized..
https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%20531%20DEL%208%20DE%20ABRIL%20DE%202020.pdf
S7_Notes:
The strict control of international travel remain unchanged, the decree that extended the general lock-down and quarantine until April 27 did not lift the prohibition of international passenger flights. Here’s the link to Decree 531:
https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%20531%20DEL%208%20DE%20ABRIL%20DE%202020.pdf

S1_Notes: Since 23 March the authorities imposed a general lockdown in the country, except for essential services. Traffic has been restricted to minimum, and only allowed with administrative authorization. It has now been extended to 16 April. Source: https://reliefweb.int/report/djibouti/republic-djibouti-covid-19-situation-report-3-9-april-2020
S2_Notes: [General geographically, otherwise this order is targeted at public employees]. On March 22, 2020, the Government of Djibouti ordered the closure of mosques, other places of worship, bars and night clubs. Public transportation was limited and non-essential staff of the Government of Djibouti were placed on administrative leave. On March 23, 2020, the Government of Djibouti announced a general confinement at home that has now been extended till April 16, 2020. In addition, stores were ordered closed with the exception of food markets, pharmacies, banks and gas stations. Sources: https://web.archive.org/save/https://dj.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-09-april-2020/; https://web.archive.org/web/20200412132818/https://reliefweb.int/report/djibouti/republic-djibouti-covid-19-situation-report-3-9-april-2020
S3_Notes: Since 23 March the authorities imposed a general lockdown in the country, except for essential services. Traffic has been restricted to minimum, and only allowed with administrative authorization. It has now been extended to 16 April. Source: https://reliefweb.int/report/djibouti/republic-djibouti-covid-19-situation-report-3-9-april-2020
S4_Notes: [Clarification: Here I am saying 'Recommended' because it says public transport was 'limited' and not completely halted.] On March 22, 2020, the Government of Djibouti ordered that public transportation was limited and non-essential staff of the Government of Djibouti were placed on administrative leave. On March 23, 2020, the Government of Djibouti announced a general confinement at home that has now been extended till April 16, 2020. In addition, stores were ordered closed with the exception of food markets, pharmacies, banks and gas stations. Sources: https://web.archive.org/save/https://dj.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-09-april-2020/; https://web.archive.org/web/20200412132818/https://reliefweb.int/report/djibouti/republic-djibouti-covid-19-situation-report-3-9-april-2020
S6_Notes: Since 23 March the authorities imposed a general lockdown in the country, except for essential services. Traffic has been restricted to minimum, and only allowed with administrative authorization. It has now been extended to 16 April. Source: https://reliefweb.int/report/djibouti/republic-djibouti-covid-19-situation-report-3-9-april-2020

S1_Notes: The government of Ecuador announced the suspension of classes in all educational establishments due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The measure is in place since March 13th. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200409021055/https://www.elcomercio.com/actualidad/feriado-viernes-santo-coronavirus-ecuador.html
S2_Notes: Since March 17, 2020, non-essential workplaces have been closed due to the health emergency. Since then, employees and employers have been asked to use digital platforms for telework. Exceptions applies to areas such as health, food provision, communication and others considered vital during the quarantine. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200409021055/https://www.elcomercio.com/actualidad/feriado-viernes-santo-coronavirus-ecuador.html
S3_Notes: Ministry María Paula Romo announced that from March 13, massive public events throughout the country are suspended indefinitely. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200411180934/https://www.metroecuador.com.ec/ec/noticias/2020/03/12/medidas-del-gobierno-ante-coronavirus-en-ecuador-se-suspenden-eventos-masivos.html
S4_Notes: Ibarra, Latacunga, Cuenca, Santo Domingo, Manta, Portoviejo and Puyo have suspended their public transportation on March, 21. Quito has been authorising essential travel only, but a completed ban was put in place for one weekend (11-12 April, 2020). Sources: https://web.archive.org/web/20200322191234/https://www.elcomercio.com/actualidad/siete-ciudades-ecuador-transporte-publico.html / https://web.archive.org/web/20200411182325/https://www.elcomercio.com/actualidad/cuarentena-semana-auto-sancion.html
S5_Notes: Official website up to date on all COVID-19 related information. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200409110834/https://coronavirusecuador.com/
S6_Notes:
A more restrictive curfew has been implemented since March 25, 2020. It is mandatory for citizens to stay at their home from 2 PM to 5 AM. 
Circulation of people and cars is regulated by IDs and vehicle licences.
Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200330120522/https://www.metroecuador.com.ec/ec/noticias/2020/03/24/lenin-moreno-amplia-toque-queda-desde-las-1400-territorio-nacional.html
S7_Notes: Ecuador has shut all its borders since March 18th. On March 22nd, the Government requested the joint commandment of the armed forces to manage the province of Guayas as a zone of national security, with the objective to enforce confinement measures, in the province concentrating the largest share (75 percent) of confirmed cases in the country. Retrieved from:https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#E
S8_Notes: 'On March 19th, further measures were announced to support the population and businesses, such as deferral of payroll contributions, exceptional cash transfer amounting to USD120 to 400 thousand poor families, later extended to 950 thousands families, distribution of food baskets, and a financing of USD50 million in credit lines for small- and medium-size businesses.' Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200409111700/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
S9_Notes: 'On March 24th, the Monetary and Financial Policy and Regulation Board issued some temporary modifications to the Monetary, Financial, Securities Code and Insurance Resolutions to support the private sector, including extraordinary deferrals of credit obligations, including from public banks, and a requirement of additional generic provisioning on banks’ gross lending portfolio during 2020.' Source: https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
S10_Notes: 'The Government invests USD 464 million in health care and social protection.' Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200412051319/https://www.eltelegrafo.com.ec/noticias/economia/4/gobierno-salud-emergencia
S12_Notes: “In several countries (…) like in Ecuador, it has been decided to carry out massive tests to identify sick and healthy carriers and thus stop the spread.” Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200406004958/https://www.elcomercio.com/actualidad/tests-rapidos-covid19-ecuador-medicos.html

S1_Notes:
The Egyptian government has decided to extend the isolation procedures to confront the Corona virus for an additional two weeks with the start of the curfew from eight in the evening until six in the morning of isolation which includes the suspension of schooling.
LINK (Arabic): https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.alarabiya.net/ar/arab-and-world/egypt/2020/04/08/???-????-?????-??????-???????-????????-???????-??????
S2_Notes:
The Egyptian government has announced the suspension of citizens movement and public transportation from 17:00 until 6:00 the following day. This includes the closure of commercial stores, discos, cafes, restaurants, and the suspension of government services such as the real estate monthly insurances for two weeks.

S5_Notes: On March 12th, 2020, the Government called together a special Committee tasked with resolving issues arising from events related to spreading of the coronavirus, public health and the economy. This is the first time an emergency situation has been called out in Estonia after regaining its independence.The committee provides information and updates about the virus: https://www.kriis.ee/en/emergency-situation-estonia

The restrictions concern movement to and from the Uusimaa region. The movement restrictions in the Uusimaa region will enter into force on 28 March and remain in force until 19 April 2020'.

https://dpi.gov.gy/covid-19-emergency-measures/

April 3 to May 3 -- Covid 19 Measures

'All persons employed within the public service, a statutory body or a State-owned enterprise shall work remotely from home'
S3_Notes:
No person shall host, attend or visit- a recreational or competitive sporting event;  a meeting of a fraternal society, private or social club or civic association or organisation; or any other social activity.

https://dpi.gov.gy/covid-19-emergency-measures/
S6_Notes:
9. Domestic Travel

(1)   Any person who provides transport within Guyana whether by land, water or air shall not carry in that transport more than half the number of passengers which the motor vehicle, vessel or aircraft is licensed to carry and the operators and passengers of any motor vehicle, vessel or aircraft shall have personal protective equipment.

(2)    A motor vehicle, vessel or aircraft shall not be used for a purpose other than a purpose related to a service under paragraphs 5 and 6.

(3)   The Police Force shall have powers to stop any motor vehicle, vessel or aircraft and inquire as to the purposes for which that motor vehicle, vessel or aircraft is being utilised, and may arrest anyone found in violation of this paragraph.

(4)   Medical evacuation flights shall be allowed with only the patient, one health official and, where necessary, one family member.

https://dpi.gov.gy/covid-19-emergency-measures/
S7_Notes:
10. International Air Travel

The Cheddi Jagan International and Eugene F. Correia International Airports shall remain closed to all international flights except for outgoing flights, cargo flights, medical evacuation flights, technical stops for fuel only and special authorised flights.

https://dpi.gov.gy/covid-19-emergency-measures/

On March 29, 2020, the Government of Jordan announced that the nationwide curfew which began March 21 will be extended until April 15.  The curfew prohibits the movement of people and closes most shops and including the closure of 'Malls and commercial complexes', 'Surgeries and medical exams will be suspended except for urgent cases', 'All institutions in the public and private sectors will be closed except for those deemed critical by the Government of Jordan.'
LINK: https://web.archive.org/web/20200407210402/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

S1_Notes: The Prime Minister announced on 10 April that the movement control order (MCO) will be extended by another two weeks, from April 15 to April 28, to curb the spread of Covid-19. 'Only State and health workers and those who maintain key infrastructure such as power, water and sanitation, among others, will be exempted from the lockdown, Mnangagwa said.' https://web.archive.org/web/20200329092507/https://www.newsday.co.zw/2020/03/mnangagwa-imposes-21-day-lockdown/ https://web.archive.org/web/20200329092553/https://www.fin24.com/News/zim-to-go-on-21-day-lockdown-starting-monday-20200327
S4_Notes: 'All public transport operations would remain suspended until further notice, except the government-owned Zupco and Public Service Commission buses' https://web.archive.org/web/20200329092507/https://www.newsday.co.zw/2020/03/mnangagwa-imposes-21-day-lockdown/ 'As part of the restrictive measures, all public transport will be grounded, save for the state-owned Zimbabwe United Passenger Company (ZUPCO) and government workers' buses, who will observe social distancing and sanitation practices. ' https://web.archive.org/web/20200329092553/https://www.fin24.com/News/zim-to-go-on-21-day-lockdown-starting-monday-20200327
S5_Notes: As part of playing our own part, Party President Adv Nelson Chamisa has initiated the #ZimLOC (Zimbabwe Lock Out Corona) campaign with a view to encouraging preparedness, especially in MDC-led councils. https://web.archive.org/web/20200327124722/https://www.zimbabwesituation.com/news/president-chamisa-initiates-zimloc-campaign/ https://web.archive.org/web/20200327125140/https://www.thezimbabwean.co/2020/03/president-chamisa-initiates-zimloc-campaign/
S6_Notes: “Starting Monday March 30, 2020, and subject to further review, Zimbabwe will be under a total lockdown for a period of 21 days,” Mnangagwa said. “This means all our citizens are required to stay at home except, of course, in respect of essential movements relating to seeking health services, to purchase and procure food and medicines and other critical services supplies.” https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.newsday.co.zw/2020/03/mnangagwa-imposes-21-day-lockdown/
S7_Notes:
International travel Ban from Monday 23rd President Emmerson Mnangagwa announced the closure of borders to human traffic on Monday We have decided to ban all non-essential traffic and travel, both inbound and outbound, except for the movement of cargo,” Mnangagwa said in a televised address to the nation. https://web.archive.org/web/20200325181727/https://www.thezimbabwean.co/2020/03/zimbabwe-shuts-borders-after-first-coronavirus-death/

“Starting Monday March 30, 2020, and subject to further review, Zimbabwe will be under a total lockdown for a period of 21 days,” Mnangagwa said. “This means all our citizens are required to stay at home except, of course, in respect of essential movements relating to seeking health services, to purchase and procure food and medicines and other critical services supplies.” https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.newsday.co.zw/2020/03/mnangagwa-imposes-21-day-lockdown/
